text.p: If the columns of [mathjaxinline]A[/mathjaxinline] form an orthonormal basis of [mathjaxinline]\mathbb R^ n[/mathjaxinline], and [mathjaxinline]\{ w_1; w_2;\ldots w_ k\}[/mathjaxinline] is an orthogonal list of vectors in [mathjaxinline]\mathbb R^ n[/mathjaxinline], then [mathjaxinline]\{ Aw_1; Aw_2;\ldots Aw_ k\}[/mathjaxinline] is also an orthogonal list of vectors.

font.p: From the video, we can conclude that [mathjaxinline]A[/mathjaxinline] preserves inner products. Thus, if [mathjaxinline]\langle w_ i, w_ j \rangle = 0[/mathjaxinline] for [mathjaxinline]i\ne j[/mathjaxinline], then we also have [mathjaxinline]\langle Aw_ i, Aw_ j \rangle = 0[/mathjaxinline] for [mathjaxinline]i\ne j[/mathjaxinline].
